ceSctpMIB.name: ceSctpMIB

revisions.description: Updated the imports such that Unsigned32 is imported from SNMPv2-SMI instead of CISCO-TC.
MIB module developed for the SIGTRAN IETF group. Based on SCTP, RFC2960

ceSctpMIB.contactinfo: Cisco Systems Customer Service Postal: 170 W Tasman Drive San Jose, CA 95134 USA Tel: +1 800 553-NETS E-mail: tac@cisco.com
ceSctpMIB.description: The MIB module for managing SCTP implementation.

InetAddressType.name: InetAddressType
InetAddressType.description: A value that represents a type of Internet address. unknown(0) An unknown address type. This value MUST be used if the value of the corresponding InetAddress object is a zero-length string. It may also be used to indicate an IP address which is not in one of the formats defined below. ipv4(1) An IPv4 address as defined by the InetAddressIPv4 textual convention. ipv6(2) An IPv6 address as defined by the InetAddressIPv6 textual convention. dns(16) A DNS domain name as defined by the InetAddressDNS textual convention. Each definition of a concrete InetAddressType value must be accompanied by a definition of a textual convention for use with that InetAddressType. The InetAddressType textual convention SHOULD NOT be subtyped in object type definitions to support future extensions. It MAY be subtyped in compliance statements in order to require only a subset of these address types for a compliant implementation.

InetAddress.name: InetAddress
InetAddress.description: Denotes a generic Internet address. An InetAddress value is always interpreted within the context of an InetAddressType value. The InetAddressType object which defines the context must be registered immediately before the object which uses the InetAddress textual convention. In other words, the object identifiers for the InetAddressType object and the InetAddress object MUST have the same length and the last sub-identifier of the InetAddressType object MUST be 1 less than the last sub-identifier of the InetAddress object. When this textual convention is used as the syntax of an index object, there may be issues with the limit of 128 sub-identifiers specified in SMIv2, STD 58. In this case, the OBJECT-TYPE declaration MUST include a 'SIZE' clause to limit the number of potential instance sub-identifiers.

ceSctpRtoAlgorithm.name: ceSctpRtoAlgorithm
ceSctpRtoAlgorithm.description: The algorithm used to determine the timeout value (T3-rtx) used for re-transmitting unacknowledged chunks.

ceSctpMaxAssociations.name: ceSctpMaxAssociations
ceSctpMaxAssociations.description: The maximum number of associations that can be supported by this implementation. set to zero to indicate unlimited.

ceSctpCurrEstab.name: ceSctpCurrEstab
ceSctpCurrEstab.description: The number of SCTP associations for which the current state is either ESTABLISHED, SHUTDOWN-RECEIVED or SHUTDOWN-PENDING.

ceSctpActiveEstab.name: ceSctpActiveEstab
ceSctpActiveEstab.description: The number of times that SCTP associations have made a direct transition to the ESTABLISH state from the COOKIE-ECHOED state: COOKIE-ECHOED -> ESTABLISHED. The upper layer has initiated the association attempt.

ceSctpPassiveEstab.name: ceSctpPassiveEstab
ceSctpPassiveEstab.description: The number of times that SCTP associations have made a direct transition to the ESTABLISHED state from the CLOSED state: CLOSED -> ESTABLISHED. The remote endpoint has initiated the association attempt.

ceSctpAborted.name: ceSctpAborted
ceSctpAborted.description: The number of times that SCTP associations have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from any state using the primitive 'ABORT': AnyState --Abort--> CLOSED. Ungraceful termination of the association.

ceSctpShutdowns.name: ceSctpShutdowns
ceSctpShutdowns.description: The number of times that SCTP associations have made a direct transition to the CLOSE state from either the SHUTDOWN-SENT state or the SHUTDOWN-ACK-SENT state. Graceful termination of the association.

ceSctpStatBytesRec.name: ceSctpStatBytesRec
ceSctpStatBytesRec.description: Number of bytes received(does not include retransmissions).

ceSctpStatBytesSent.name: ceSctpStatBytesSent
ceSctpStatBytesSent.description: Number of bytes sent(does not include retransmissions).

ceSctpStatChunksDiscard.name: ceSctpStatChunksDiscard
ceSctpStatChunksDiscard.description: Number of chunks that were discarded.

ceSctpStatChunksSent.name: ceSctpStatChunksSent
ceSctpStatChunksSent.description: Number of SCTP control and data chunks, sent to the peers (no retransmissions included).

ceSctpStatChunksSentControl.name: ceSctpStatChunksSentControl
ceSctpStatChunksSentControl.description: Number of SCTP control chunks sent to the peers (no retransmissions included).

ceSctpStatChunksSentOrdered.name: ceSctpStatChunksSentOrdered
ceSctpStatChunksSentOrdered.description: Number of SCTP data chunks sent that required order to be maintained. (no retransmissions included).

ceSctpStatChunksSentUnOrdered.name: ceSctpStatChunksSentUnOrdered
ceSctpStatChunksSentUnOrdered.description: Number of SCTP data chunks sent that do not required order to be maintained. (no retransmissions included).

ceSctpStatChunksRec.name: ceSctpStatChunksRec
ceSctpStatChunksRec.description: Number of SCTP control and data chunks, received from the peers (no retransmissions included).

ceSctpStatChunksRecControl.name: ceSctpStatChunksRecControl
ceSctpStatChunksRecControl.description: Number of SCTP control chucks received from peers (no retransmissions included).

ceSctpStatChunksRecOrdered.name: ceSctpStatChunksRecOrdered
ceSctpStatChunksRecOrdered.description: Number of SCTP data chunks received that required order to be maintained. (no retransmissions included).

ceSctpStatChunksRecUnOrdered.name: ceSctpStatChunksRecUnOrdered
ceSctpStatChunksRecUnOrdered.description: Number of SCTP data chunks received that do not required order to be maintained. (no retransmissions included).

ceSctpStatDatagramsRec.name: ceSctpStatDatagramsRec
ceSctpStatDatagramsRec.description: Number datagrams sent(does not include retransmissions).

ceSctpStatDatagramsSent.name: ceSctpStatDatagramsSent
ceSctpStatDatagramsSent.description: Number datagrams sent(does not include retransmissions).

ceSctpStatFragmentedUsrMessages.name: ceSctpStatFragmentedUsrMessages
ceSctpStatFragmentedUsrMessages.description: Number of user messages that have to be fragmented because of the MTU.

ceSctpStatChunksReTrans.name: ceSctpStatChunksReTrans
ceSctpStatChunksReTrans.description: Number of chunks that were re-transmitted.

ceSctpStatOutOfBlue.name: ceSctpStatOutOfBlue
ceSctpStatOutOfBlue.description: Number of out of the blue packets (SCTP packet correctly formed -right checksum- but the receiver is not able to identify the association to which this packet belongs) received by the host.

ceSctpStatT1expired.name: ceSctpStatT1expired
ceSctpStatT1expired.description: Number of times that T1 timer expired (timer for sending either INIT or COOKIE-ECHO chunks and receiving an acknowledgment).

ceSctpStatT2expired.name: ceSctpStatT2expired
ceSctpStatT2expired.description: Number of times that T2-shutdown timer expired (shutdown timer).

ceSctpAssocTable.name: ceSctpAssocTable
ceSctpAssocTable.description: A table containing SCTP association-specific information.

ceSctpAssocEntry.name: ceSctpAssocEntry
ceSctpAssocEntry.description: General common variables and statistics for the whole association.

ceSctpAssocId.name: ceSctpAssocId
ceSctpAssocId.description: Association Identification. Value identifying the association (typically the Initiate Verification Tag).

ceSctpAssocState.name: ceSctpAssocState
ceSctpAssocState.description: The state of this SCTP association. As in TCP, the only value which may be set by a management station is deleteTCB. Accordingly, it is appropriate for an agent to return a 'badValue' response if a management station attempts to set this object to any other value. If a management station sets this object to the value deleteTCB(9), then this has the effect of deleting the TCB (as defined in SCTP) of the corresponding association on the managed node, resulting in immediate termination of the association. As an implementation-specific option, an ABORT chunk may be sent from the managed node to the other SCTP endpoint.

ceSctpAssocUpTime.name: ceSctpAssocUpTime
ceSctpAssocUpTime.description: Time association has been in established state.

ceSctpAssocRtoMin.name: ceSctpAssocRtoMin
ceSctpAssocRtoMin.description: The minimum value permitted by a SCTP implementation for the retransmission timeout, measured in milliseconds. More refined semantics for objects of this type depend upon the algorithm used to determine the retransmission timeout. Minimum recommended value is 1000 milliseconds. Some telephone applications could require less than 1 second.

ceSctpAssocRtoMax.name: ceSctpAssocRtoMax
ceSctpAssocRtoMax.description: The maximum value permitted by a SCTP implementation for the retransmission timeout, measured in milliseconds. More refined semantics for objects of this type depend upon the algorithm used to determine the retransmission timeout. Recommended value is 60000 milliseconds.

ceSctpAssocRtoInitial.name: ceSctpAssocRtoInitial
ceSctpAssocRtoInitial.description: Initial value for the Retransmission timer. Recommended value is 3000 milliseconds.

ceSctpAssocValCookieLife.name: ceSctpAssocValCookieLife
ceSctpAssocValCookieLife.description: Valid cookie life in the 4-way start-up handshake procedure. Recommended value: 60000 milliseconds.

ceSctpAssocMaxInitRetr.name: ceSctpAssocMaxInitRetr
ceSctpAssocMaxInitRetr.description: The maximum number of retransmissions at the start-up phase (INIT and COOKIE ECHO chunks). Recommended value: 8 attempts.

ceSctpAssocInitialT1.name: ceSctpAssocInitialT1
ceSctpAssocInitialT1.description: Initial value for the Start-up T1 timer.

ceSctpAssocInitialT2.name: ceSctpAssocInitialT2
ceSctpAssocInitialT2.description: Initial value for the Shutdown T2-shutdown timer.

ceSctpAssocRemHostName.name: ceSctpAssocRemHostName
ceSctpAssocRemHostName.description: Peer's DNS name. If no DNS domain name was received at init time (embedded in the INIT or INIT-ACK chunk) from the peer, this entry will be meaningless, therefore it will contain a NULL value. Otherwise, the remote host name received at init time will be stored.

ceSctpAssocLocalSCTPPort.name: ceSctpAssocLocalSCTPPort
ceSctpAssocLocalSCTPPort.description: Local SCTP port number used for this association.

ceSctpAssocRemSCTPPort.name: ceSctpAssocRemSCTPPort
ceSctpAssocRemSCTPPort.description: Remote SCTP port number used for this association.

ceSctpAssocRemPrimaryAddressType.name: ceSctpAssocRemPrimaryAddressType
ceSctpAssocRemPrimaryAddressType.description: Internet type of primary destination IP address. - unknown (0) An unknown address type. This value MUST be used if the value of the corresponding InetAddress object is a zero-length string. It may also be used to indicate an IP address different from IPv4 or IPv6. This value is used in this MIB for error conditions. - ipv4 (1): An IPv4 address as defined by the InetAddressIPv4 textual convention [RFC2851]. - ipv6 (2): An IPv6 address as defined by the InetAddressIPv6 textual convention [RFC2851].

ceSctpAssocRemPrimaryAddress.name: ceSctpAssocRemPrimaryAddress
ceSctpAssocRemPrimaryAddress.description: Primary destination IP address. An InetAddress value is always interpreted within the context of an InetAddressType value. This value will be filled in after INIT or INIT ACK messages have been received (when the primary path is selected by SCTP).

ceSctpAssocCongestionAbate1.name: ceSctpAssocCongestionAbate1
ceSctpAssocCongestionAbate1.description: Threshold used to abate congestion level 1.

ceSctpAssocCongestionAbate2.name: ceSctpAssocCongestionAbate2
ceSctpAssocCongestionAbate2.description: Threshold used to abate congestion level 2.

ceSctpAssocCongestionAbate3.name: ceSctpAssocCongestionAbate3
ceSctpAssocCongestionAbate3.description: Threshold used to abate congestion level 3.

ceSctpAssocCongestionOnset1.name: ceSctpAssocCongestionOnset1
ceSctpAssocCongestionOnset1.description: Threshold used to mark onset of congestion level 1.

ceSctpAssocCongestionOnset2.name: ceSctpAssocCongestionOnset2
ceSctpAssocCongestionOnset2.description: Threshold used to mark onset of congestion level 2.

ceSctpAssocCongestionOnset3.name: ceSctpAssocCongestionOnset3
ceSctpAssocCongestionOnset3.description: Threshold used to mark onset of congestion level 3.

ceSctpAssocInStreams.name: ceSctpAssocInStreams
ceSctpAssocInStreams.description: Inbound Streams according to the negotiation at association start up. This parameter has to be read-only by the manager.

ceSctpAssocOutStreams.name: ceSctpAssocOutStreams
ceSctpAssocOutStreams.description: Outbound Streams according to the negotiation at association start up. This parameter has to be read-only by the manager.

ceSctpAssocMaxRetr.name: ceSctpAssocMaxRetr
ceSctpAssocMaxRetr.description: The maximum number of data retransmissions. This value is specific for each association and the upper layer can be able to change it calling the appropriate primitives. This value has to be smaller than the addition of all the maximum number for all the paths (sctpAssocRemAddressMaxPathRetran). Recommended value: 10 attempts.

ceSctpAssocMTU.name: ceSctpAssocMTU
ceSctpAssocMTU.description: The Maximum Transmission Size to be used by this association. The size will the smallest MTU size supported by any of the IP Addresses used by the association.

ceSctpAssocLocRecWnd.name: ceSctpAssocLocRecWnd
ceSctpAssocLocRecWnd.description: The current local receive window size for this association.

ceSctpAssocLocRecWndLowMark.name: ceSctpAssocLocRecWndLowMark
ceSctpAssocLocRecWndLowMark.description: Low water mark for Local Receive Window Size.

ceSctpAssocLocRecWndZeroCnt.name: ceSctpAssocLocRecWndZeroCnt
ceSctpAssocLocRecWndZeroCnt.description: Number of times the Local Receive window reached zero bytes.

ceSctpAssocRemRecWnd.name: ceSctpAssocRemRecWnd
ceSctpAssocRemRecWnd.description: The Remote Receive Window Size for this association.

ceSctpAssocRemRecWndLowMark.name: ceSctpAssocRemRecWndLowMark
ceSctpAssocRemRecWndLowMark.description: Low water mark for Remote Receive Window Size.

ceSctpAssocRemRecWndZeroCnt.name: ceSctpAssocRemRecWndZeroCnt
ceSctpAssocRemRecWndZeroCnt.description: Number of times the Remote Receive window reached zero bytes.

ceSctpAssocULPDatagramsQueued.name: ceSctpAssocULPDatagramsQueued
ceSctpAssocULPDatagramsQueued.description: Number of data grams waiting to be sent.

ceSctpAssocULPDatagramsQueuedHigh.name: ceSctpAssocULPDatagramsQueuedHigh
ceSctpAssocULPDatagramsQueuedHigh.description: High water mark for data grams waiting to be sent.

ceSctpAssocChecksumErrorCounter.name: ceSctpAssocChecksumErrorCounter
ceSctpAssocChecksumErrorCounter.description: Number of SCTP packets received from the peers with an invalid checksum.

ceSctpAssocBytesSent.name: ceSctpAssocBytesSent
ceSctpAssocBytesSent.description: Number of bytes sent by this association.

ceSctpAssocBytesRec.name: ceSctpAssocBytesRec
ceSctpAssocBytesRec.description: Number of bytes received by this association.

ceSctpAssocChunksDiscarded.name: ceSctpAssocChunksDiscarded
ceSctpAssocChunksDiscarded.description: Total number of Chucks discarded by this association.

ceSctpAssocChunksRec.name: ceSctpAssocChunksRec
ceSctpAssocChunksRec.description: Total number of Chucks received by this association.

ceSctpAssocChunksRecControl.name: ceSctpAssocChunksRecControl
ceSctpAssocChunksRecControl.description: Number of control Chucks received by this association.

ceSctpAssocChunksRecOrdered.name: ceSctpAssocChunksRecOrdered
ceSctpAssocChunksRecOrdered.description: Number of Chucks received by this association where order is required.

ceSctpAssocChunksRecUnOrdered.name: ceSctpAssocChunksRecUnOrdered
ceSctpAssocChunksRecUnOrdered.description: Number of Chucks received by this association where order is not required.

ceSctpAssocChunksRecOutOrder.name: ceSctpAssocChunksRecOutOrder
ceSctpAssocChunksRecOutOrder.description: Number of Chucks received out of order by this association.

ceSctpAssocChunksReTrans.name: ceSctpAssocChunksReTrans
ceSctpAssocChunksReTrans.description: Total number of Chucks retransmitted by this association.

ceSctpAssocChunksSent.name: ceSctpAssocChunksSent
ceSctpAssocChunksSent.description: Total number of Chucks sent by this association.

ceSctpAssocChunksSentControl.name: ceSctpAssocChunksSentControl
ceSctpAssocChunksSentControl.description: Number of control Chucks sent by this association.

ceSctpAssocChunksSentOrdered.name: ceSctpAssocChunksSentOrdered
ceSctpAssocChunksSentOrdered.description: Number of Chucks sent by this association where order is required.

ceSctpAssocChunksSentUnOrdered.name: ceSctpAssocChunksSentUnOrdered
ceSctpAssocChunksSentUnOrdered.description: Number of Chucks sent by this association where order is not required.

ceSctpAssocDatagramsRec.name: ceSctpAssocDatagramsRec
ceSctpAssocDatagramsRec.description: Number of packets received by this association.

ceSctpAssocDatagramsSent.name: ceSctpAssocDatagramsSent
ceSctpAssocDatagramsSent.description: Number of packets sent by this association.

ceSctpAssocRowStatus.name: ceSctpAssocRowStatus
ceSctpAssocRowStatus.description: An object that allows entries in this table to be created and deleted using the RowStatus convention. A row in this table will be created after creating the TCB in both sides of the association. The creation of this row implies the creation of at least another row (depending on the number of local and remote addresses) in the tables sctpAssocLocalAddressTable and sctpAssocRemAddressTable. A row is deleted in sctpAssocTable when an association turns down (i.e., when the TCB is deleted according to [sctp] in both sides of the association). The deletion of a row in sctpAssocTable implies the deletion of the tables related to this association (sctpAssocLocalAddressTable and sctpAssocRemAddressTable). Also, a row is deleted in sctpAssocTable when a set operation is received from the manager with destroy option.

ceSctpAssocLocalAddressTable.name: ceSctpAssocLocalAddressTable
ceSctpAssocLocalAddressTable.description: Expanded table of ceSctpAssocTable based on the AssocId index. It shows several interesting data for each local address which takes part in this association.

ceSctpAssocLocalAddressEntry.name: ceSctpAssocLocalAddressEntry
ceSctpAssocLocalAddressEntry.description: Local information about the available addresses.

ceSctpAssocLocalAddressIPType.name: ceSctpAssocLocalAddressIPType
ceSctpAssocLocalAddressIPType.description: Internet type of local IP address used for this association. - unknown (0) An unknown address type. This value MUST be used if the value of the corresponding InetAddress object is a zero-length string. It may also be used to indicate an IP address different from IPv4 or IPv6. This value is used in this MIB for error conditions. - ipv4 (1): An IPv4 address as defined by the InetAddressIPv4 textual convention [RFC2851]. - ipv6 (2): An IPv6 address as defined by the InetAddressIPv6 textual convention [RFC2851].

ceSctpAssocLocalAddressIP.name: ceSctpAssocLocalAddressIP
ceSctpAssocLocalAddressIP.description: The value of a local IP address available for this association. An InetAddress value is always interpreted within the context of an InetAddressType value. If SCTP are using DNS names, the mapping to IP address-es will be done at reception of INIT or INIT_ACK messages.

ceSctpAssocLocalAddressRowStatus.name: ceSctpAssocLocalAddressRowStatus
ceSctpAssocLocalAddressRowStatus.description: An object that allows entries in this table to be created and deleted using the RowStatus convention. A row in this table will be created per local IP address defined for this association. The creation takes part when a new row in the sctpAssocTable is created or when a new IP address is added in the local interface (if this function is enabled by the SCTP layer). A row in this table will be deleted per local IP address reserved for the association when the corresponding row in sctpAssocTable is deleted or when an IP address is removed from the local interface (if this function is enabled by the SCTP layer).

ceSctpAssocRemAddressTable.name: ceSctpAssocRemAddressTable
ceSctpAssocRemAddressTable.description: Expanded table of ceSctpAssocTable based on the AssocId index. It shows several interesting data for each remote peer IP address which is used in this association.

ceSctpAssocRemAddressEntry.name: ceSctpAssocRemAddressEntry
ceSctpAssocRemAddressEntry.description: Information about THE most important variables for every remote IP address

ceSctpAssocRemAddressIPType.name: ceSctpAssocRemAddressIPType
ceSctpAssocRemAddressIPType.description: Internet type of a remote IP address available for this association. - unknown (0) An unknown address type. This value MUST be used if the value of the corresponding InetAddress object is a zero-length string. It may also be used to indicate an IP address different from IPv4 or IPv6. This value is used in this MIB for error conditions. - ipv4 (1): An IPv4 address as defined by the InetAddressIPv4 textual convention [RFC2851]. - ipv6 (2): An IPv6 address as defined by the InetAddressIPv6 textual convention [RFC2851].

ceSctpAssocRemAddressIP.name: ceSctpAssocRemAddressIP
ceSctpAssocRemAddressIP.description: The value of a remote IP address available for this association. An InetAddress value is always interpreted within the context of an InetAddressType value.

ceSctpAssocRemAddressStatus.name: ceSctpAssocRemAddressStatus
ceSctpAssocRemAddressStatus.description: The current status of the remote transport address, according to [SCTP]. active - Destination is alive and active inActive - Destination used as source address only failed - Destination has failed

ceSctpAssocRemAddressRTO.name: ceSctpAssocRemAddressRTO
ceSctpAssocRemAddressRTO.description: The current Retransmision Time-Out. T3-rtx timer as defined in the protocol SCTP.

ceSctpAssocRemAddressHtBtFlag.name: ceSctpAssocRemAddressHtBtFlag
ceSctpAssocRemAddressHtBtFlag.description: The optional Heartbeat associated to one destination transport address could be active or not (value equal to 1 or 0, respectively). An active destination transport address is the one considered available by a peer endpoint for receiving SCTP packets, as it is described in [sctp].

ceSctpAssocRemAddressHtBtTime.name: ceSctpAssocRemAddressHtBtTime
ceSctpAssocRemAddressHtBtTime.description: The current heartbeat time-out. The recommended default value is 30000 milliseconds.

ceSctpAssocRemAddressMaxRetran.name: ceSctpAssocRemAddressMaxRetran
ceSctpAssocRemAddressMaxRetran.description: Maximum number of DATA retransmissions allowed to a remote IP address before it is considered inactive, as defined in [sctp]. Recommended value 5 attempts.

ceSctpAssocRemAddressRetransCnt.name: ceSctpAssocRemAddressRetransCnt
ceSctpAssocRemAddressRetransCnt.description: Number of DATA retransmissions as defined in [sctp].

ceSctpAssocRemAddressSRTT.name: ceSctpAssocRemAddressSRTT
ceSctpAssocRemAddressSRTT.description: Smoothed Round Trip Time in milliseconds.

ceSctpAssocRemAddressRowStatus.name: ceSctpAssocRemAddressRowStatus
ceSctpAssocRemAddressRowStatus.description: An object that allows entries in this table to be created and deleted using the RowStatus convention. A row in this table will be created per remote IP address defined for this association. The creation takes part when a new row in the sctpAssocTable is created or when a new IP address is added in the remote interface (if this function is enabled by the SCTP layer). A row in this table will be deleted per remote IP address reserved for the association when the corresponding row in sctpAssocTable is deleted or when an IP address is removed from the local interface (if this function is enabled by the SCTP layer).

ceSctpCompliance.name: ceSctpCompliance
ceSctpCompliance.description: The compliance statement for SNMPv3 entities which implement SCTP.

ceSctpGeneralVariablesGroup.name: ceSctpGeneralVariablesGroup
ceSctpGeneralVariablesGroup.description: The sctp group of objects providing for management of SCTP entities. Common parameters for the protocol.

ceSctpStateStatGroup.name: ceSctpStateStatGroup
ceSctpStateStatGroup.description: The sctp group of objects to control state changes in the SCTP protocol.

ceSctpOtherStatGroup.name: ceSctpOtherStatGroup
ceSctpOtherStatGroup.description: The sctp group of objects providing for management of SCTP general statistics.

ceSctpAssocTablesVariablesGroup.name: ceSctpAssocTablesVariablesGroup
ceSctpAssocTablesVariablesGroup.description: The sctp group of objects to manage specific local and remote SCTP variables (local and remote tables).

ceSctpAssocStatGroup.name: ceSctpAssocStatGroup
ceSctpAssocStatGroup.description: The sctp group of objects to manage SCTP statistics related to the remote endpoint.
